DETAILS: NOTE not all cameras are the same! they are slightly off in their own units   unit in diopters 1/meters but not really specific details come from https://libcamera.org/api-html/namespacelibcamera_1_1controls.html#a7fcbbf6b3870d6edfd8cd00194df2ecb
adjusts auto exposure algorithm 0 is nomal positive is brighter Floating point number between -8.0 and 8.0
0 is off 3 is HDR with 3 photos -  1-2 is also off  3 and up is that many photos to take
duration of exposure to shift on both sides doesnt do anything if HDR is not enabled
0 is off and using only manual controls   1 will enable autocalibration to happen if the Calibration Period has elapsed
Seconds since last autocalibration to run a new calibration
0 is jpeg   1 is png (larger file size and much slower to save but no compression)  2 is BMP HUGE file but very fast to save
0 is no flip     1 is flip the image vertically mothbox v4 uses FLIP
NOTE=we actually just use serial number to create unique name - not used anymore
